data.template:
| Detection | Count |
| --- | --- |
%%
| {0} | {1} |
%%



*Follow the prompt to manage these related findings in the Analyst Queue.*

parameters.title: Related Findings in the Analyst Queue:

data.message:
This Risk Finding under investigation is composed of many related findings and intermediate findings.

You can browse all these related findings on a risk timeline in the Overview Tab.

Please select a response below to manage these findings in the Analyst Queue while you continue to work on the investigation.

{0}

responses.responsePrompt: Do you want to close these individual findings?

parameters.title: Analyst decision to close related findings

parameters.display: source, source_event_id _time, annotations.mitre_attack, entity, risk_object, normalized_risk_object, threat_object, threat_match_value, risk_message, threat_object_type

query.template:
| `risk_event_timeline_search("{0}","{1}")`
| where _time>={2} AND _time<={3}
| search eventtype="notable"
| fields source, source_event_id _time, annotations.mitre_attack, entity, risk_object, normalized_risk_object, threat_object, threat_match_value, risk_message, threat_object_type
| `add_events({4})`

parameters.content: Based on the negative response of the user prompt to close findings, all related findings have NOT been closed in the Analyst Queue.
parameters.title: Analyst decision to NOT close related findings

    gather_entities_and_indicators__entities = []

            gather_entities_and_indicators__entities.append(pair)

    seen = set()
    gather_entities_and_indicators__indicators = []
    for pair in list(zip(run_query_1_result_item_0,run_query_1_result_item_1)):

            gather_entities_and_indicators__indicators.append(pair)

content.template:
There are no individual findings in this investigation as it is comprised of only "Intermediate Findings".


To review the Intermediate Findings, check the "Overview" tab

list_demux.description: Accepts a single list and converts it into multiple custom function output results. All output will be placed in the "output" datapath. Sub-items and sub-item variable names are dependent on the input.

fields.description: A list of objects. Nested lists are not unpacked.
fields.label: input_list
fields.name: input_list
